result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ASHLEA LYNN HEFLEN in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for ASHLEA LYNN HEFLEN. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
No to to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with co-defendant, Cassandra Montonya. May have one time contact to obtain belongings. To be arranged through Victim Witness.
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.

Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ASHLEA LYNN HEFLEN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for ASHLEA LYNN HEFLEN.
